Architecture¶

things to mention:

  • canonical IDs for pages, issues

  • how files are packaged into compressed JSON lines archives

  • page images are expected to be served by an image server

  • how things are processed in parallel using dask

Processing¶

Functions to perform large-scale import of OCR data.

Add additional bla bla bla about parallel processing and dask.

text_importer.importers.core.compress_issues(key: Tuple[str, int], issues: List[text_importer.importers.classes.NewspaperIssue], output_dir: str = None) → Tuple[str, str]¶

Short summary.

Parameters

  • key (type) – Description of parameter key.

  • issues (list) – A list of NewspaperIssue instances.

  • output_dir (type) – Description of parameter output_dir.

Returns

a tuple with [0] being NEWSPAPER-YEAR and [1] the path of the compressed file

text_importer.importers.core.compress_pages(key: str, json_files: List, output_dir: str, prefix: str = '') → Tuple[str, str]¶

Merges a set of JSON line files into a single compressed archive.

Parameters

  • key – signature of the newspaper issue (e.g. GDL-1900)

  • json_files – input JSON line files

  • output_dir – directory where to write the output file

  • prefix –

Returns

a tuple with: sorting key [0] and path to serialized file [1].

Note

sort_key is expected to be the concatenation of newspaper ID and year (e.g. GDL-1900).

text_importer.importers.core.dir2issue(issue: impresso_commons.path.path_fs.IssueDirectory, issue_class: Type[text_importer.importers.classes.NewspaperIssue], image_dirs=None, temp_dir=None) → Tuple[Optional[text_importer.importers.classes.NewspaperIssue], Optional[str]]¶

Instantiates a NewspaperIssue instance from an IssueDir.

text_importer.importers.core.import_issues(issues: List[impresso_commons.path.path_fs.IssueDirectory], out_dir: str, s3_bucket: Optional[str], issue_class: Type[text_importer.importers.classes.NewspaperIssue], image_dirs: str, temp_dir: str)¶

Imports a bunch of newspaper issues.

Parameters

  • issues (list) – Description of parameter issues.

  • out_dir (str) – Description of parameter out_dir.

  • s3_bucket (str) – Description of parameter s3_bucket.

  • issue_class – The newspaper issue class to import (Child of NewspaperIssue)

  • image_dirs – Directory of images (can be multiple)

  • temp_dir – Temporary directory for extracting archives (For Olive format)

Returns

Description of returned object.

Return type

tuple

text_importer.importers.core.issue2pages(issue: text_importer.importers.classes.NewspaperIssue) → List[text_importer.importers.classes.NewspaperPage]¶

Processes the pages of the given issue

text_importer.importers.core.upload_issues(sort_key: str, filepath: str, bucket_name: str = None) → Tuple[bool, str]¶

Uploads a file to a given S3 bucket. :param sort_key: the key used to group articles (e.g. “GDL-1900”) :param filepath: path of the file to upload to S3 :param bucket_name: name of S3 bucket where to upload the file :return: a tuple with [0] whether the upload was successful (boolean) and

[1] the path of the uploaded file (string)

Note

sort_key is expected to be the concatenation of newspaper ID and year (e.g. GDL-1900).

text_importer.importers.core.upload_pages(sort_key: str, filepath: str, bucket_name: str = None) → Tuple[bool, str]¶

Uploads a file to a given S3 bucket. :param sort_key: the key used to group articles (e.g. “GDL-1900”) :param filepath: path of the file to upload to S3 :param bucket_name: name of S3 bucket where to upload the file :return: a tuple with [0] whether the upload was successful (boolean) and

[1] the path of the uploaded file (string)

Note

sort_key is expected to be the concatenation of newspaper ID and year (e.g. GDL-1900).
